segment.source: MD Conversion - Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports
segment.target: MD Conversion - Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports

segment.source: MD Conversion - Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports
segment.target: MD Conversion - Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports

segment.source: Use the information in this topic to help you create and manage reports that provide information about software, hardware, and software licenses in your organization.
segment.target: Use the information in this topic to help you create and manage reports that provide information about software, hardware, and software licenses in your organization.

segment.source: Using Reports
segment.target: Using Reports

segment.source: reports provide information about software, hardware, and software licenses in your organization.
segment.target: reports provide information about software, hardware, and software licenses in your organization.

segment.source: Reports can help you confirm current needs and forecast future spending.
segment.target: Reports can help you confirm current needs and forecast future spending.

segment.source: The Reports workspace gives you the tools to create and manage reports.
segment.target: The Reports workspace gives you the tools to create and manage reports.

segment.source: For more information about reports, see Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports.
segment.target: For more information about reports, see Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports.

segment.source: Report types
segment.target: Report types

segment.source: Report type
segment.target: Report type

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Update reports
segment.target: Update reports

segment.source: Show the software updates that succeeded on computers in your organization, in addition to the updates that failed, are pending, or are needed.
segment.target: Show the software updates that succeeded on computers in your organization, in addition to the updates that failed, are pending, or are needed.

segment.source: For more information on software updates, see Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information on software updates, see Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Detected Software reports
segment.target: Detected Software reports

segment.source: Show software installed on computers in your organization and includes the software versions.
segment.target: Show software installed on computers in your organization and includes the software versions.

segment.source: You can filter the information that displays based on the software publisher and the software category.
segment.target: You can filter the information that displays based on the software publisher and the software category.

segment.source: You can expand the updates in the list to show more detail (such as the computers on which it is installed) by clicking the directional arrow next to the list item.
segment.target: You can expand the updates in the list to show more detail (such as the computers on which it is installed) by clicking the directional arrow next to the list item.

segment.source: When you retire computers or change their group memberships in , it can take several minutes for these changes to be reflected in the detected software report.
segment.target: When you retire computers or change their group memberships in , it can take several minutes for these changes to be reflected in the detected software report.

segment.source: For the most accurate software inventory data, wait a few minutes after retiring computers or changing their group memberships before you run a detected software report that includes those computers.
segment.target: For the most accurate software inventory data, wait a few minutes after retiring computers or changing their group memberships before you run a detected software report that includes those computers.

segment.source: Computer Inventory reports
segment.target: Computer Inventory reports

segment.source: Show information about managed computers in your organization.
segment.target: Show information about managed computers in your organization.

segment.source: Use this report to plan hardware purchases and to understand more about the hardware needs of users in your organization.
segment.target: Use this report to plan hardware purchases and to understand more about the hardware needs of users in your organization.

segment.source: For more information on working with managed computers, see Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information on working with managed computers, see Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Mobile Device Inventory reports
segment.target: Mobile Device Inventory reports

segment.source: Show information about the mobile devices in your organization.
segment.target: Show information about the mobile devices in your organization.

segment.source: You can filter the information that displays based on groups, whether the device is a jailbroken or rooted device, and by operating system.
segment.target: You can filter the information that displays based on groups, whether the device is a jailbroken or rooted device, and by operating system.

segment.source: License Purchase reports
segment.target: License Purchase reports

segment.source: Show the software titles for all licensed software in selected license groups, based on their licensing agreements.
segment.target: Show the software titles for all licensed software in selected license groups, based on their licensing agreements.

segment.source: If software license information has not refreshed in more than 24 hours, it will refresh when you generate a license report.
segment.target: If software license information has not refreshed in more than 24 hours, it will refresh when you generate a license report.

segment.source: A license report is not an exact calculation of software titles that are being used, or proof of compliance with agreements.
segment.target: A license report is not an exact calculation of software titles that are being used, or proof of compliance with agreements.

segment.source: The report is a tool to help you make licensing decisions for your organization.
segment.target: The report is a tool to help you make licensing decisions for your organization.

segment.source: might not detect some products that are able to have a Microsoft volume license.
segment.target: might not detect some products that are able to have a Microsoft volume license.

segment.source: The available filters are:
segment.target: The available filters are:

segment.source: All agreements shows all licensed software products that are managed by .
segment.target: All agreements shows all licensed software products that are managed by .

segment.source: Volume licensing agreements shows only VLSC software products.
segment.target: Volume licensing agreements shows only VLSC software products.

segment.source: Other software licensing agreements shows software products that are managed outside VLSC.
segment.target: Other software licensing agreements shows software products that are managed outside VLSC.

segment.source: License installation reports
segment.target: License installation reports

segment.source: Compare installed software on computers in your organization with your current license agreement coverage according to the Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC).
segment.target: Compare installed software on computers in your organization with your current license agreement coverage according to the Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC).

segment.source: Filters include:
segment.target: Filters include:

segment.source: All agreements shows all licensed software products that are managed by .
segment.target: All agreements shows all licensed software products that are managed by .

segment.source: Volume licensing agreements shows only VLSC software products.
segment.target: Volume licensing agreements shows only VLSC software products.

segment.source: Other software licensing agreements shows software products that are managed outside VLSC.
segment.target: Other software licensing agreements shows software products that are managed outside VLSC.

segment.source: Terms and Conditions reports
segment.target: Terms and Conditions reports

segment.source: Shows whether users accepted terms and conditions you deployed, and which version they accepted.
segment.target: Shows whether users accepted terms and conditions you deployed, and which version they accepted.

segment.source: You can specify up to 10 users whose acceptance of any terms and conditions that were deployed to them are shown, or show the acceptance status for a particular term deployed to them.
segment.target: You can specify up to 10 users whose acceptance of any terms and conditions that were deployed to them are shown, or show the acceptance status for a particular term deployed to them.

segment.source: Noncompliant Apps reports
segment.target: Noncompliant Apps reports

segment.source: Show information about the users who have apps installed that are on your lists of compliant and noncompliant apps.
segment.target: Show information about the users who have apps installed that are on your lists of compliant and noncompliant apps.

segment.source: Use this report to find users and devices that are not in compliance with your company app policies.
segment.target: Use this report to find users and devices that are not in compliance with your company app policies.

segment.source: Certificate Compliance reports
segment.target: Certificate Compliance reports

segment.source: Shows which certificates have been issued to users and devices through the Network Device Enrollment Service.
segment.target: Shows which certificates have been issued to users and devices through the Network Device Enrollment Service.

segment.source: Use this report to find certificates that are issued, expired, and revoked.
segment.target: Use this report to find certificates that are issued, expired, and revoked.

segment.source: Device History reports
segment.target: Device History reports

segment.source: Shows a historical log of retire, wipe, and delete actions.
segment.target: Shows a historical log of retire, wipe, and delete actions.

segment.source: Use this report to see who initiated actions on devices in the past.
segment.target: Use this report to see who initiated actions on devices in the past.

segment.source: Mac OS X Hardware Report
segment.target: Mac OS X Hardware Report

segment.source: Displays hardware details for all enrolled Mac OS X devices in the groups you select.
segment.target: Displays hardware details for all enrolled Mac OS X devices in the groups you select.

segment.source: For information about the hardware inventory collected from these devices, see Understand your devices with inventory in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For information about the hardware inventory collected from these devices, see Understand your devices with inventory in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Mac OS X Software Report
segment.target: Mac OS X Software Report

segment.source: Displays the software installed on all Mac OS X devices in the groups you selected.
segment.target: Displays the software installed on all Mac OS X devices in the groups you selected.

segment.source: The report lists the software name (as a bundle ID), the short version (or friendly) name, the version, and the number of devices with the software installed.
segment.target: The report lists the software name (as a bundle ID), the short version (or friendly) name, the version, and the number of devices with the software installed.

segment.source: To create a report
segment.target: To create a report

segment.source: In the , click Reports, and then click the report type you want to generate, described on the table above.
segment.target: In the , click Reports, and then click the report type you want to generate, described on the table above.

segment.source: On the Create New Report page, accept the default values or customize them to filter the results that will be returned by the report.
segment.target: On the Create New Report page, accept the default values or customize them to filter the results that will be returned by the report.

segment.source: For example, you could select that only software published by Microsoft will be displayed in the detected software report.
segment.target: For example, you could select that only software published by Microsoft will be displayed in the detected software report.

segment.source: Click View Report to open the report in a new window.
segment.target: Click View Report to open the report in a new window.

segment.source: To sort the report by any of the displayed columns, click the column heading.
segment.target: To sort the report by any of the displayed columns, click the column heading.

segment.source: Additionally, some reports allow you to expand items in the list to show more detail.
segment.target: Additionally, some reports allow you to expand items in the list to show more detail.

segment.source: More report actions
segment.target: More report actions

segment.source: In addition, reports support the following actions:
segment.target: In addition, reports support the following actions:

segment.source: Action
segment.target: Action

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Print
segment.target: Print

segment.source: In an open report, click the print icon and follow the instructions.
segment.target: In an open report, click the print icon and follow the instructions.

segment.source: Export
segment.target: Export

segment.source: In an open report, click the export icon and follow the instructions.
segment.target: In an open report, click the export icon and follow the instructions.

segment.source: You can export a report to comma separated values (.csv) or HTML format.
segment.target: You can export a report to comma separated values (.csv) or HTML format.

segment.source: Save
segment.target: Save

segment.source: On the Create New Report page, each user can save up to 100 reports.
segment.target: On the Create New Report page, each user can save up to 100 reports.

segment.source: Configure the report parameters to your requirements and then click Save, or Save As if you want to use a different name.
segment.target: Configure the report parameters to your requirements and then click Save, or Save As if you want to use a different name.

segment.source: Load
segment.target: Load

segment.source: On the Create New Report page, click Load to retrieve any previously saved sets of report parameters.
segment.target: On the Create New Report page, click Load to retrieve any previously saved sets of report parameters.

segment.source: Delete
segment.target: Delete

segment.source: In the Reports workspace, select the desired report type, click Load, and then, in the list of reports, click the delete (x) icon next to the report.
segment.target: In the Reports workspace, select the desired report type, click Load, and then, in the list of reports, click the delete (x) icon next to the report.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Monitoring and reports with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Monitoring and reports with Microsoft Intune
